I don't get where all this "Riot officially labelled her a support" even comes from.
They just released a subclass list, that subclass list has **absolutely nothing** to do with the role a champion is played in.
It is just a description of the playstyle of the champion.

Kindred are a marksman, does that mean that Kindred are played bot lane?
No, Kindred are a marksman played in the jungle role.

Same here. They just created a new subclass called "catcher". These have a playstyle that specialises in **catching** enemies to make them vulnerable for their own damage and the damage of their team. So you can say they are specialists in creating picks.
Even Jhin is considered to be hybrid catcher! Because his W and R are giving him tools to create picks for his team.

Nowhere it is stated that Zyra is a support. I think people are interpreting too much into that stuff.
Yeah, good point, these subclasses show playstyles, not necessarily lane or position.

When they were updating her in the MYMU, her updates were considered initially only for the support role because 'she is a support'. The end result of her being consecutively nerfed to suit a role she was disproportionately powerful in, rather than the one she was intended to be in. There was a degree of backlash to this statement but it didn't change much in the end.

I just want to point out because I hate people that just trot out winrates like it means anything:

Look at the **play rate difference** between support and mid. 95.6% of her games are support, with less than 4% being mid... Which leads me to believe only mains/skilled Zyra players play her mid, which accounts for the higher w/r.

I'm not saying she should or should not be played mid, I'm just saying that the winrate being slightly higher in mid can be explained by only people with Zyra skillz playing her mid. It doesn't necessarily mean she's "better" mid than she is support. Winrates don't work like that.

These subclasses aren't even official tags! Riot doesn't want to put them in the client like some are asking for because they are more guidelines to help with balance and design and are subject to change every few months or so. They aren't technically official, and the only official tags are "Fighters" "Tanks" "Mages" etc, tags that are unlikely to change. These subclasses serve to put similar champions next to one another to see if they are truly unique or if Riot needs to work on giving them their own gameplay identity. They are NOT little boxes Riot is trying to shove every single Champion into. Rengar being a diver is not going to prevent them from giving the jump from stealth gameplay that Rengar players love. Karma or LB don't suddenly have different playstyles. Zyra is not going to instantly become unviable anywhere but support just because she's in a so-called "support" subclass. These subclasses are not the end all, be all like everyone supposes they are. That's why they were changed after revisiting them. And they will probably be changed again!

People get confused with between the support *role* and support *champions* (ie. Zyra has a supportive *kit*, and is also predominantly played in the support *role*. Miss Fortune has a marksman's *kit*, and is sometimes played in the support *role*, sometimes in the ~~marksman~~ ADC *role*). It's part of the reason Riot has been working on the class and subclass list, changing labels to something less confusing. Also why Riot has made official communications regarding "off-meta"playstyles recently. 

As an aside, people often confuse official Riot communications with the random, off-hand comments from a Rioter on forums/social media. Riot is no more a hivemind than Boards/Reddit, probably even less so since they don't have internal upvote circlejerks.
Marksmen is not a role. The role you are referring is carry. The role is pretty much the lane you go on.
lol see, even I get confused. Thanks :P

Zyra actually doesn't have a supportive kit.  She has damage and CC and that's it.

She can be played in the support role anyway, using harass and zoning and trying to catch out enemies, but it doesn't make her a support champion any more than Annie.

Lulu, Lux and Karma are mage kits with actual support elements.  Nami, Sona and Soraka are enchanters.

Zyra has one of the strongest disengage and zone control kits in the game. It's incredibly potent for setting up your teammates. That's a supportive kit. That's exactly the point I was making about a kit that's supportive and a champion that's played in the support role. It's not about making an overly simplified list of what a champion does and does not have in their kit; it's about how that kit functions as a whole. Ashe has a supportive kit (if you go back, she was actually classified as a secondary support). It doesn't matter that she's seldom if ever played in the support role, her kit supports her team (another term for her is "utility carry"). Contrast that with someone like Xerath/Zed, who mostly set themselves up even though they also have CC.

#Ummm.... _what_?

* Ivern's whole kit revolves around _clearing jungle camps_, his primary role is **Jungle** not support.

* Zyra has traditionally since her release been an AP mage designed for solo laning (hence her reliance on spawning plants for crowd control/farming)

* Same with morg as above

* Nunu's whole kit revolves around _consuming jungle camps / monsters_ and his primary role has always been **Jungle**

They were not created as _support role champions_, but can be played as one.

The problem some players are having, are **champions whose original design and kit revolved around solo lane power, are now recently being repeatedly nerfed/reworked/crippled and forced to be viable only as a support**.

Instead of working on way to _properly balance_ some of these champion's oppressive nature with their original kit in the support role while still maintaining the integrity of their original design, Riot has taken a sub-par approach by crippling/changing their original abilities and solo lane power, in favor of keeping them "less oppressive" when used as a support.

It's like if suddenly you found a way to make support Morde extremely OP in the bot 2v2 lane, and it caught on across the meta; then because of complaints about "Support Morde too oppressive", Riot decides to completely rework his abilities (again) and/or cripple his damage output, in favor of more "support friendly damage" and converting his skills to "teamwork utility" skills instead.

I don't know about you, but if that happened to a champion I loved to play, I'd be understandably _pissed_.
